column4: hi there. I would like to install a newer version of a package then the one that is available in Synaptic is there a way to do this? I'm actually referring to the package maven
now Synaptic has 2.0.8, but I would like to install 2.0.9
is there a way to find out if there is a newer version in Synaptic...
but I'm still on hardy, but would like the version 2.0.9 of maven
is there a way to get the intrepid version installed?
don't mix version repos, a very bad idea
so I need to install it manually? why don't ubuntu make 2.0.9 available for hardy?
mixing those packages is not supported and will lead to problems
ok I unerstand, but what is the policy of ubuntu of packages update?
it might be in backports, otherwise the only option is to upgrade versions
ok in backport. I will take a look at backport
should I look in the hardy backports repos if I'm using hardy?
one more Q how can I find out that I'm really using hardy.
is there a way to propose a new package in the backport?
